metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11707 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
A type confusion vulnerability can occur when manipulating JavaScript objects due to issues in Array.pop. This can allow for an exploitable crash. We are aware of targeted attacks in the wild abusing this flaw. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.7.1, Firefox < 67.0.3, and Thunderbird < 60.7.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11707` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine msalvatore> PoC does not cause a crash in mozjs38. The code has also significantly diverged.

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
